issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The barcode module 2.3.0 in Titanium crashes when an i18n/en/strings.xml file is pressent in root of an application.
h4. Repo Steps
1. Create a new Mobile App select the Single Window Template (it will create the i18n folder). Copy the content of the Example app.js from the module folder in to your project's app.js
2. Run the app in Android device. Click the Scan Code button and the app will crash.
fields.summary: Module : Barcode module crashes when an i18n/en/strings.xml file is pressent in root of an application.
fields.environment:
android 2.2.2
Barcode module 2.3.0
LG Optimus V
Ti SDK 2.0.1.GA2

comments.body:
I would like to confirm this issue. 

android 2.3.5
Barcode module 2.3.0
LG Optimus V
Ti SDK 2.0.1.GA2

Removing the strings.xml file results in a positive scan. With the strings.xml file in place, the app crashes as soon as the scan button is tapped.

This is a critical issue for us, as we have a multilingual application to deliver with the scanning functionality. 

Any word on a quick resolve regarding this issue ?

Kind regards,
Wouter van den Bosch
Created the above module ticket a TIMOB by mistake. I've created the same as a module ticket. Will be taken care by our module expert.
Created a module ticket as a TIMOB by mistake. Thats why closing it as invalid. Created the same issue as a module ticket.
Thx Nikhil. Can you link me to the new issue, so I can watch it ?

Hi,  
I'm sorry Wouter. We are not allowed to make module ticket links public. Its a company policy. I'll make sure that it'll get fixed soon. We have one more customer who is facing the same issue. Could you please tell me your time frame to get a fix for this issue? I'll keep you updated here.

Thanks

Hi Nikhil,

Thanks for the update. No problem with your company policy.

Our iOS version works just fine. Our Android version should be out within two weeks.

Thanks for taking this into account!

Best regards,
Wouter

Hi Wouter,   
Thanks for understanding. I'll try to get you a fix before that. Will tell our module expert about your time frame. I'll keep you updated.


Regards,  
Nikhil

I'm having this same problem and would like to know what the fix was. This bug's status is closed but I don't see any documentation on the resolution. Would someone provide insight into what I can do to fix this problem?

Hi Neal, 

I've yet to hear from Appcelerator on the status of the fix to the module, mentioned by Nikhil.

In the meanwhile, we have released a temporary single-language version of our Android app to the customer, without the strings file, which is far from ideal of course.

@Nikhil, could you perhaps inform us on the status of the module's issue ?

Thanks!

Hi All,  
Sorry for the inconvenience. The fix is scheduled for Sprint 2012-13.
